citation.article-title: Bacillus alkalidiazotrophicus sp. nov., a diazotrophic, low salt-tolerant alkaliphile isolated from Mongolian soda soil.
citation.source: International Journal of Systematic and Evolutionary Microbiology

p.s: Description of Bacillus alkalidiazotrophicus sp. nov.

Bacillus alkalidiazotrophicus [al.ka.li.di.a.zo.tro′phi.cus. N.L. n. alkali (from Arabic al qaliy soda ash); N.L. masc. adj. diazotrophicus feeding on dinitrogen; N.L. adj. alkalidiazotrophicus alkaliphile fixing dinitrogen].
Cells are large Gram-positive rods with tapered edges, 0.6–1.2×3–8 μm, and are highly motile with peritrichous flagella.
The following carbohydrates can be fermented: glucose, fructose, maltose, sucrose, melibiose, melezitose, cellobiose, raffinose, trehalose, mannitol and lactose (weakly).
Also capable of hydrolysis and utilization of starch and glycogen.
Obligate alkaliphile with a pH range for growth between 7.8 and 10.6 (optimum is 9.5) and a salt range from 0.1 to 1.2 M Na+ (optimum is 0.2–0.4 M).
Mesophilic with a temperature range for growth between 15 and 43 °C (optimum at 33–35 °C).
The dominant fatty acids include C16 : 0, C16 : 1ω7, anteiso-C15 : 0 and C14 : 0.
The dominant isoprenoid quinone is MK-7.
The cell-wall peptidoglycan contains meso-diaminopimelic acid as the diagnostic diamino acid.
The type strain, MS 6T (=NCCB 100213T=UNIQEM U377T), was isolated from soda solonchak soil in Mongolia.
The DNA G+C content of the type strain is 37.1 mol% (Tm).
